frameworks.name: Worden’s Tasks of Mourning
frameworks.summary: Accept the reality of the loss, process the pain, adjust to a world without the loved one, and find an enduring connection while moving forward.

frameworks.name: Dual Process Model (Stroebe & Schut)
frameworks.summary: Grievers oscillate between confronting the loss and restoring life routines. Both are essential to adaptive coping.

frameworks.name: Meaning Reconstruction (Neimeyer)
frameworks.summary: Grief involves rebuilding life meaning and personal identity in the absence of a loved one.
